Context:
George Brown College is the largest culinary school in Canada, located in downtown Toronto. They offer a blend of theoretical and experiential education for students to succeed in the culinary and food industry. The college has best-in-class learning environments and training locations, as well as extensive externship and recruitment opportunities, and a Dean's recognition program.

George Brown College recently launched Canada's first four-year Honours Bachelor of Food Studies Degree and Culinary Management Honours Bachelor Degree programs. The college has an impressive alumni list that includes notable chefs such as Mark McEwan, Jamie Kennedy, Bonnie Stern, and Roger Mooking, among others.

The Centre for Hospitality and Culinary Arts at George Brown is LEAF Certified for its efforts towards becoming an environmentally-friendly and sustainable foodservice establishment. The college offers a free Entry Advising service to help match students' skills and career goals with program options.

Program information sessions are available, where faculty and staff answer questions and showcase classrooms, labs, and facilities. Recruitment representatives can be contacted for virtual meetings or inquiries by country of origin. The college also acknowledges the indigenous lands on which it operates and keeps students informed about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more through signing up on their website or contacting ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
